data.event: Founded in 1803 as a penal colony, Hobart is Australia's second oldest capital city after Sydney, New South Wales.
The first settlement began in 1803 as a penal colony at Risdon Cove on the eastern shores of the Derwent River, amid British concerns over the presence of French explorers.
In 1804 it was moved to a better location at the present site of Hobart at Sullivans Cove.
